title: SFEC Form 134b - Candidate's Notice of Exceeding 100 Percent of the Voluntary Expenditure Ceiling - Filings
description:
SFEC Form 134b is for use by a candidate for Assessor, Public Defender, City Attorney, District Attorney, Treasurer, Sheriff, the Board of Education or the Community College Board who has received contributions, made qualified campaign expenditures, incurred expenses or have funds in his or her Campaign Contribution Trust Account that exceed 100 percent of the applicable ceiling.  This form must be filed by the candidate and received by the San Francisco Ethics Commission within 24 hours of reaching the 100 percent threshold. See S.F. Campaign & Governmental Conduct Code 
Â§ 1.134(b).  This form must be filed only if at least one candidate for the City elective office has accepted the applicable voluntary expenditure ceiling, and the Ethics Commission has not lifted that voluntary expenditure ceiling.  This dataset includes filings received starting March 2, 2020.

columns.name: DocuSign ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the filing, generated automatically by DocuSign

columns.name: Filing
columns.description: URL to download PDF copy of the filing

columns.name: Office Sought
columns.description: Name of office sought.  Options include:  Assessor, Public Defender, City Attorney, District Attorney, Treasurer, Sheriff, the Board of Education or the Community College Board

columns.name: Threshold Date
columns.description: Date candidate exceeded 100 percent of the applicable expenditure ceiling

columns.name: Contributions Checkbox
columns.description: Method in which the candidate exceeded the ceiling.  This indicates that the candidate "received contributions" that exceeded 100 percent of the applicable ceiling.

columns.name: Expenditures Checkbox
columns.description: Method in which the candidate exceeded the ceiling.  This indicates that the candidate "made or incurred qualified campaign expenditures" that exceeded 100 percent of the applicable ceiling.

columns.name: Trust Account Checkbox
columns.description: Method in which the candidate exceeded the ceiling.  This indicates that the candidate "have funds in my campaign trust account" that exceeded 100 percent of the applicable ceiling.

columns.name: Candidate Name
columns.description: Name of candidate that exceeded the ceiling

columns.name: Date Signed
columns.description: Date form signed and filed by filer

columns.name: FPPC ID
columns.description: FPPC ID number of candidate's campaign committee
